description: Stoke City 0-1 Everton: Amadou Onana scores late winner
title: Stoke City 0-1 Everton: Amadou Onana scores late winner
title_page: Stoke City 0-1 Everton: Amadou Onana scores late winner - BBC Sport
maintext:
Amadou Onana's goal deep into stoppage time earned Everton a 1-0 friendly win at Championship side Stoke City on Saturday.
Onana pounced from close range in the 96th minute after James Tarkowski had headed back across goal.
New loan signing Arnaut Danjuma played his first minutes the the Toffees, spearheading a front three that also included Dwight McNeil and Alex Iwobi.
Speaking after the game, Everton manager Sean Dyche said he was happy with his players' mentality in battling right until the end to secure the victory.
"I was screaming at them at the end to keep pressing, keep playing. We want that extra fitness because games are probably going to be longer this year," he told the club's official website.
"It’s important the players stay on it and stay focused, which they did.
"We need players physically ready but, of course, it’s also about having that edge to win games, and I thought they carried it all the way through.
"I was pleased with the mentality overall."
Everton complete their pre-season schedule when they welcome Sporting Lisbon to Goodison Park on 5 August (15:00 BST kick-off).
